definition: to collapse/to fall apart
Tu (ethnic group)/surname Tu
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard

sentences.english: Sooner or later, it might all come crashing down. But Kevin did not really care.
sentences.chinese: 早早晚晚，這種生活會土崩瓦解，可凱文並布在乎。

sentences.english: Clearly, these tenets are already disintegrating in a country like Greece.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，這些原則在希臘這樣的國家已土崩瓦解。

sentences.english: This regional bloc has fallen apart.
sentences.chinese: 這一地區性集團已土崩瓦解。

sentences.english: In fact it was probably truncated as the coil disintegrated .
sentences.chinese: 事實上，它可能是截短作爲線圈土崩瓦解。

sentences.english: The corruption, nepotism, favoritism, moneyembezzlement, all and all will fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗，裙帶關係，徇私枉法以及貪污都將土崩瓦解。
